doc.previous: In 1326 Provost Adam de Brome was appointed warden of St Bartholomew's;[33] a leper hospital in Cowley Marsh, the hospital was later granted to the college by Edward III, along with the payments it had been receiving from the fee farm. It was increasingly used as a rest house for sick members of the college needing a change of air.[34] In 1649 the college rebuilt the main hospital range north of the chapel, destroyed in the Civil War, as a row of four almshouses, called Bartlemas House.[35] Bartlemas Chapel and two farm cottages are the other extant buildings.
doc.after: In heraldic terminology: Gules, three lions passant guardant Or within a bordure engrailed Argent.
